title: Could anyone identify this 70s font
content:
A client would like to use a retro logo of theirs for a special project.

Can anyone identify the attached - I'm sure it's an old Letraset font but can't place it. Any pointers are much appreciated. (I'm afraid the attached scan is from an old Newspaper ad and isn't brilliant.)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [B&S Advert.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054809/http:/typophile.com/files/B&S%20Advert.jpg) | 60.21 KB |
author: Barry Roubaix

comments.content: That's [Windsor Elongated](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054809/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=windsor&btnG.x=6&btnG.y=10&site=d&sample_text=Barker%20%26%20Stonehouse), Woody Allen's fetish typeface for his movie titles. The ampersand is from the Regular weight.

Looks like a pre-digital [Windsor Elongated](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054809/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/scangraphic/windsor_sb_elongated/?sample_text=BarkerStonehouse&sample_size=60) or [Condensed Extra Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113054809/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/urw/windsor_condensed_extra_bold/?sample_text=BarkerStonehouse&sample_size=60).
